content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the command "write_to_file" to create a file named "river_restoration_summary.txt" and wrote a summary of the River Restoration Centre's Manual of River Restoration Techniques. I also used the command "google" to search for "river restoration techniques" and "browse_website" to gather information from the River Restoration Centre's website. I used the command "read_file" to read the text from a file named "river_restoration_techniques.txt". I then used the command "append_to_file" to add a sentence to a file named "river.txt". I used the command "list_files" to list the files in the current directory and "delete_file" to delete a file named "new_file.txt". I used the command "execute_shell" to create a directory named "river_data" and attempted to clone a Github repository, but encountered an error. I used the command "get_text_summary" to gather a summary of the text on the River Restoration Centre's website and added it to the "river_restoration_summary.txt" file using the "write_to_file" command.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "How to turn a river into a lake"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/145055/how-glaciers-turn-lakes-turquoise", "https://hookedonwildwaters.com/river-become-lake/", "https://www.kjrh.com/news/local-news/tulsa-and-jenks-city-leaders-incog-and-tribal-leaders-announce-lake-along-arkansas-river-corridor", "https://www.usgs.gov/special-topics/water-science-school/science/rivers-streams-and-creeks", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_River", "https://www.nps.gov/yell/learn/nature/water.htm", "https://www.npr.org/2022/03/16/1086988193/st-patricks-day-green-chicago-river", "https://www.nps.gov/lake/learn/nature/overview-of-lake-mead.htm"]', type='action_result')]
"""
